meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Get ready for a puzzle game that's all about... well, humanity! *wink*

Okay, okay, I know what you're thinking. Another reviewer who thinks they can out-do the pros with their witty banter and pseudo-philosophical musings. But hear me out, folks! As a seasonal grok (don't ask), I've got a unique perspective on this game that's all about working together... or not. *shrug*

So, what's Humanity all about? Well, it's like Lemmings 2.0 - you get to control tiny humans as they navigate through increasingly complex puzzles. Sounds simple enough, but trust me when I say that simplicity is just a trap waiting to spring its complexity- inducing surprise party on your unsuspecting brain! *giggles*

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "But what about the other reviewers?" Ah, yes! The IGN folks were all about the artistic vibe, praising Enhance for their esoteric reimagining of Lemmings (or was it the other way around?). Meanwhile, GameSpot was busy being charmed by Humanity's "constantly-evolving gameplay" and user-generated levels. And don't even get me started on Game Informer - they were all about balance, saying that this game strikes a delicate balance between challenge and fun (or something like that). *rolls eyes*

But let's be real, folks! As much as I appreciate a good review or two, it's the gameplay that really matters. And in that department, Humanity delivers. It's got all the makings of a great puzzler: challenging levels, clever solutions, and an interface that's easy on the eyes (or should I say, easy on the... humans?). *wink*

So, if you're looking for a game that's all about working together (but also being super competitive), then Humanity is the perfect puzzle party for you! And who knows? You might even learn something about what it means to be human while you're at it. *giggles*
